properties.description: The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Org name

properties.name: full_name
properties.description: (Required) Org full name

properties.name: delete_recursive
properties.description: (Required)

properties.name: delete_force
properties.description: (Required)

properties.name: is_enabled
properties.description: (Optional)

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional)

properties.name: deployed_vm_quota
properties.description: (Optional)

properties.name: stored_vm_quota
properties.description: (Optional)

properties.name: can_publish_catalogs
properties.description: (Optional)

properties.name: delay_after_power_on_seconds
properties.description: (Optional)

properties.name: sources
properties.description: » Sources
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: org
properties.description: (Optional) The name of organization to which the VDC belongs. Optional if defined at provider level.

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) A unique name for the user.

properties.name: password
properties.description: (Optional, but required if password_file was not given) The user password. This value is never returned on read. It is inspected on create and modify. To modify, fill with a different value. Note that if you remove the password on update, Terraform will indicate that a change was occurring, but the empty password will be ignored by vCD.

properties.name: password_file
properties.description: (Optional, but required if password was not given). A text file containing the password. Recommended usage: after changing the password, run an apply again with the password blank. Using this property instead of password has the advantage that the sensitive data is not saved into Terraform state file. The disadvantage is that a password change requires also changing the file name.

properties.name: provider_type
properties.description: (Optional) Identity provider type for this this user. One of: INTEGRATED, SAML, OAUTH. The default is INTEGRATED.

properties.name: list description
Organization Administrator
Catalog Author
vApp Author
vApp User
Console Access Only
Defer to Identity Provider
full_name
properties.description: (Optional) The full name of the user.

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) An optional description of the user.

properties.name: telephone
properties.description: (Optional) The Org User telephone number.

properties.name: email_address
properties.description: (Optional) The Org User email address. Needs to be a properly formatted email address.

properties.name: instant_messaging
properties.description: (Optional) The Org User instant messaging.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: (Optional) True if the user is enabled and can log in. The default is true.

properties.name: is_group_role
properties.description: (Optional) True if this user has a group role.. The default is false.

properties.name: is_locked
properties.description: (Optional)aIf the user account has been locked due to too many invalid login attempts, the value will change to true (only the system can lock the user). To unlock the user re-set this flag to false.

properties.name: take_ownership
properties.description: (Optional) Take ownership of user's objects on deletion.

properties.name: deployed_vm_quota
properties.description: (Optional) Quota of vApps that this user can deploy. A value of 0 specifies an unlimited quota. The default is 10.

properties.name: stored_vm_quota
properties.description: (Optional) Quota of vApps that this user can store. A value of 0 specifies an unlimited quota. The default is 10.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: org
properties.description: (Optional) The name of organization to use, optional if defined at provider level. Useful when connected as sysadmin working across different organisations

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Catalog name

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional)

properties.name: delete_recursive
properties.description: (Required)

properties.name: delete_force
properties.description: -(Required) - When destroying use delete_force=True with delete_recursive=True to remove a catalog and any objects it contains, regardless of their state
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: org
properties.description: (Optional) The name of organization to use, optional if defined at provider level. Useful when connected as sysadmin working across different organisations

properties.name: catalog
properties.description: (Required) The name of the catalog where to upload OVA file

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Item name in catalog

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional)

properties.name: ova_path
properties.description: (Required)

properties.name: upload_piece_size
properties.description: (Optional)

properties.name: show_upload_progress
properties.description: (Optional)
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: org
properties.description: (Optional) The name of organization to use, optional if defined at provider level. Useful when connected as sysadmin working across different organisations

properties.name: catalog
properties.description: (Required) The name of the catalog where to upload media file

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Media file name in catalog

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional)

properties.name: media_path
properties.description: (Required)

properties.name: upload_piece_size
properties.description: (Optional)

properties.name: show_upload_progress
properties.description: (Optional)
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: edge_gateway
properties.description: (Required) The name of the edge gateway on which to apply the DNAT

properties.name: external_ip
properties.description: (Required) One of the external IPs available on your Edge Gateway

properties.name: port
properties.description: (Required) The port number to map. -1 translates to "any"

properties.name: translated_port
properties.description: (Optional) The port number to map

properties.name: internal_ip
properties.description: (Required) The IP of the VM to map to

properties.name: protocol
properties.description: (Optional; v2.0+) The protocol type. Possible values are tcp, udp, tcpupd, icmp, any. tcp is default to be backward compatible with previous version

properties.name: icmp_sub_type
properties.description: (Optional; v2.0+) The name of ICMP type. Possible values are address-mask-request, destination-unreachable, echo-request, echo-reply, parameter-problem, redirect, router-advertisement, router-solicitation, source-quench, time-exceeded, timestamp-request, timestamp-reply, any

properties.name: network_type
properties.description: (Optional; v2.4+) Type of the network on which to apply the NAT rule. Possible values org or ext. ext requires system administrator privileges. network_type will be a required field in the next major version.

properties.name: network_name
properties.description: (Optional; v2.4+) The name of the network on which to apply the SNAT. network_name will be a required field in the next major version.

properties.name: org
properties.description: (Optional; v2.0+) The name of organization to use, optional if defined at provider level. Useful when connected as sysadmin working across different organisations

properties.name: vdc
properties.description: (Optional; v2.0+) The name of VDC to use, optional if defined at provider level

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional; v2.4+)
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) A unique name for the network

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) Network friendly description

properties.name: ip_scope
properties.description: (Required) A list of IP scopes for the network. See IP Scope below for details.

properties.name: vsphere_network
properties.description: (Required) A list of DV_PORTGROUP or NETWORK objects names that back this network. Each referenced DV_PORTGROUP or NETWORK must exist on a vCenter server registered with the system. See vSphere Network below for details.

properties.name: retain_net_info_across_deployments
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies whether the network resources such as IP/MAC of router will be retained across deployments. Default is false.

properties.name: ip-scope
properties.description: » IP Scope

properties.name: gateway
properties.description: (Required) Gateway of the network

properties.name: netmask
properties.description: (Required) Network mask

properties.name: dns1
properties.description: (Optional) Primary DNS server

properties.name: dns2
properties.description: (Optional) Secondary DNS server

properties.name: dns_suffix
properties.description: (Optional) A FQDN for the virtual machines on this network.

properties.name: static_ip_pool
properties.description: (Required) IP ranges used for static pool allocation in the network. See IP Pool below for details.

properties.name: ip-pool
properties.description: » IP Pool

properties.name: start_address
properties.description: (Required) Start address of the IP range

properties.name: end_address
properties.description: (Required) End address of the IP range

properties.name: vsphere-network
properties.description: » vSphere Network

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Port group name

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Required) The vSphere type of the object. One of: DV_PORTGROUP (distributed virtual port group), NETWORK (standard switch port group)

properties.name: vcenter
properties.description: (Required) The vCenter server name
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: edge_gateway
properties.description: (Required) The name of the edge gateway on which to apply the Firewall Rules

properties.name: default_action
properties.description: (Required) Either "allow" or "drop". Specifies what to do should none of the rules match

properties.name: rule
properties.description: (Optional) Configures a firewall rule; see Rules below for details.

properties.name: org
properties.description: (Optional; v2.0+) The name of organization to use, optional if defined at provider level. Useful when connected as sysadmin working across different organisations

properties.name: vdc
properties.description: (Optional; v2.0+) The name of VDC to use, optional if defined at provider level

properties.name: rules
properties.description: » Rules
Each firewall rule supports the following attributes:

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Required) Description of the fireall rule

properties.name: policy
properties.description: (Required) Specifies what to do when this rule is matched. Either "allow" or "drop"

properties.name: protocol
properties.description: (Required) The protocol to match. One of "tcp", "udp", "icmp" or "any"

properties.name: destination_port
properties.description: (Required) The destination port to match. Either a port number or "any"

properties.name: destination_ip
properties.description: (Required) The destination IP to match. Either an IP address, IP range or "any"

properties.name: source_port
properties.description: (Required) The source port to match. Either a port number or "any"

properties.name: source_ip
properties.description: (Required) The source IP to match. Either an IP address, IP range or "any"
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: org
properties.description: (Optional) The name of organization to use, optional if defined at provider level. Useful when connected as sysadmin working across different organisations

properties.name: vdc
properties.description: (Optional) The name of VDC to use, optional if defined at provider level

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Disk name

properties.name: size
properties.description: (Required)

properties.name: bus_type
properties.description: (Optional)

properties.name: bus_sub_type
properties.description: (Optional)

properties.name: storage_profile
properties.description: (Optional)
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: org
properties.description: (Optional; v2.0+) The name of organization to use, optional if defined at provider level. Useful when connected as sysadmin working across different organisations

properties.name: vdc
properties.description: (Optional; v2.0+) The name of VDC to use, optional if defined at provider level

properties.name: catalog
properties.description: (Required) The name of the catalog where to find media file

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Media file name in catalog which will be inserted to VM

properties.name: vapp_name
properties.description: (Required)

properties.name: vm_name
properties.description: (Required)

properties.name: eject_force
properties.description: (Optional; v2.1+) Allows to pass answer to question in vCD "The guest operating system has locked the CD-ROM door and is probably using the CD-ROM. Disconnect anyway (and override the lock)?" when ejecting from a VM which is powered on. True means "Yes" as answer to question. Default is true
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) A unique name for the network

properties.name: edge_gateway
properties.description: (Required) The name of the edge gateway

properties.name: netmask
properties.description: (Optional) The netmask for the new network. Defaults to 255.255.255.0

properties.name: gateway
properties.description: (Required) The gateway for this network

properties.name: dns1
properties.description: (Optional) First DNS server to use. Defaults to 8.8.8.8

properties.name: dns2
properties.description: (Optional) Second DNS server to use. Defaults to 8.8.4.4

properties.name: dns_suffix
properties.description: (Optional) A FQDN for the virtual machines on this network

properties.name: shared
properties.description: (Optional) Defines if this network is shared between multiple vDCs in the vOrg. Defaults to false.

properties.name: dhcp_pool
properties.description: (Optional) A range of IPs to issue to virtual machines that don't have a static IP; see IP Pools below for details.

properties.name: static_ip_pool
properties.description: (Optional) A range of IPs permitted to be used as static IPs for virtual machines; see IP Pools below for details.

properties.name: ip-pools
properties.description: » IP Pools
Static IP Pools and DHCP Pools support the following attributes:

properties.name: start_address
properties.description: (Required) The first address in the IP Range

properties.name: end_address
properties.description: (Required) The final address in the IP Range
DHCP Pools additionally support the following attributes:

properties.name: default_lease_time
properties.description: (Optional) The default DHCP lease time to use. Defaults to 3600.

properties.name: max_lease_time
properties.description: (Optional) The maximum DHCP lease time to use. Defaults to 7200.

properties.description: » IP Pools
Static IP Pools and DHCP Pools support the following attributes:

properties.name: start_address
properties.description: (Required) The first address in the IP Range

properties.name: end_address
properties.description: (Required) The final address in the IP Range
DHCP Pools additionally support the following attributes:

properties.name: default_lease_time
properties.description: (Optional) The default DHCP lease time to use. Defaults to 3600.

properties.name: max_lease_time
properties.description: (Optional) The maximum DHCP lease time to use. Defaults to 7200.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: edge_gateway
properties.description: (Required) The name of the edge gateway on which to apply the SNAT

properties.name: external_ip
properties.description: (Required) One of the external IPs available on your Edge Gateway

properties.name: internal_ip
properties.description: (Required) The IP or IP Range of the VM(s) to map from

properties.name: network_type
properties.description: (Optional; v2.4+) Type of the network on which to apply the NAT rule. Possible values org or ext. network_type will be a required field in the next major version.

properties.name: network_name
properties.description: (Optional; v2.4+) The name of the network on which to apply the SNAT. network_name will be a required field in the next major version.

properties.name: org
properties.description: (Optional; v2.0+) The name of organization to use, optional if defined at provider level. Useful when connected as sysadmin working across different organisations

properties.name: vdc
properties.description: (Optional; v2.0+) The name of VDC to use, optional if defined at provider level

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional; v2.4+)
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: org
properties.description: (Optional) The name of organization to which the VDC belongs. Optional if defined at provider level.

properties.name: vdc
properties.description: (Optional) The name of VDC that owns the edge gateway. Optional if defined at provider level.

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) A unique name for the edge gateway.

properties.name: external_networks
properties.description: (Required) An array of external network names.

properties.name: configuration
properties.description: (Required) Configuration of the vShield edge VM for this gateway. One of: compact, full ("Large"), x-large, full4 ("Quad Large").

properties.name: default_gateway_network
properties.description: (Optional) Name of the external network to be used as default gateway. It must be included in the list of external_networks. Providing an empty string or omitting the argument will create the edge gateway without a default gateway.

properties.name: advanced
properties.description: (Optional) True if the gateway uses advanced networking. Default is true.

properties.name: ha_enabled
properties.description: (Optional) Enable high availability on this edge gateway. Default is false.

properties.name: distributed_routing
properties.description: (Optional) If advanced networking enabled, also enable distributed routing. Default is false.

properties.name: lb_enabled
properties.description: (Optional) Enable load balancing. Default is false.

properties.name: lb_acceleration_enabled
properties.description: (Optional) Enable to configure the load balancer to use the faster L4 engine rather than L7 engine. The L4 TCP VIP is processed before the edge gateway firewall so no allow firewall rule is required. Default is false. Note: L7 VIPs for HTTP and HTTPS are processed after the firewall, so when Acceleration Enabled is not selected, an edge gateway firewall rule must exist to allow access to the L7 VIP for those protocols. When Acceleration Enabled is selected and the server pool is in non-transparent mode, an SNAT rule is added, so you must ensure that the firewall is enabled on the edge gateway.

properties.name: lb_logging_enabled
properties.description: (Optional) Enables the edge gateway load balancer to collect traffic logs. Default is false.

properties.name: lb_loglevel
properties.description: (Optional) Choose the severity of events to be logged. One of emergency, alert, critical, error, warning, notice, info, debug
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: edge_gateway
properties.description: (Required) The name of the edge gateway on which to apply the Firewall Rules

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the VPN

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Required) A description for the VPN

properties.name: encryption_protocol
properties.description: (Required)

properties.name: local_ip_address
properties.description: (Required)

properties.name: local_id
properties.description: (Required)

properties.name: mtu
properties.description: (Required)

properties.name: peer_ip_address
properties.description: (Required)

properties.name: peer_id
properties.description: (Required)

properties.name: shared_secret
properties.description: (Required)

properties.name: local_subnets
properties.description: (Required)

properties.name: peer_subnets
properties.description: (Required)

properties.name: org
properties.description: (Optional; v2.0+) The name of organization to use, optional if defined at provider level. Useful when connected as sysadmin working across different organisations

properties.name: vdc
properties.description: (Optional; v2.0+) The name of VDC to use, optional if defined at provider level

properties.name: local-subnets
properties.description: » Local Subnets
Each Local Subnet supports the following attributes:

properties.name: local_subnet_name
properties.description: (Required) Name of the local subnet

properties.name: local_subnet_gateway
properties.description: (Required) Gateway of the local subnet

properties.name: local_subnet_mask
properties.description: (Required) Subnet mask of the local subnet

properties.name: peer-subnets
properties.description: » Peer Subnets
Each Peer Subnet supports the following attributes:

properties.name: peer_subnet_name
properties.description: (Required) Name of the peer subnet

properties.name: peer_subnet_gateway
properties.description: (Required) Gateway of the peer subnet

properties.name: peer_subnet_mask
properties.description: (Required) Subnet mask of the peer subnet
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) A unique name for the vApp

properties.name: catalog_name
properties.description: (Optional) The catalog name in which to find the given vApp Template

properties.name: template_name
properties.description: (Optional) The name of the vApp Template to use

properties.name: memory
properties.description: (Optional) The amount of RAM (in MB) to allocate to the vApp

properties.name: cpus
properties.description: (Optional) The number of virtual CPUs to allocate to the vApp

properties.name: initscript
properties.description: (Optional) A script to be run only on initial boot

properties.name: network_name
properties.description: (Optional) Name of the network this vApp should join

properties.name: network_href
properties.description: (Optional; Deprecated) The vCloud Director generated href of the network this vApp should join. If empty it will use the network name and query vCloud Director to discover this

properties.name: ip
properties.description: (Optional) The IP to assign to this vApp. Must be an IP address or one of dhcp, allocated or none. If given the address must be within the static_ip_pool set for the network. If left blank, and the network has dhcp_pool set with at least one available IP then this will be set with DHCP.

properties.name: metadata
properties.description: (Optional) Key value map of metadata to assign to this vApp. Key and value can be any string. (Since v2.2+ metadata is added directly to vApp instead of first VM in vApp)

properties.name: ovf
properties.description: (Optional) Key value map of ovf parameters to assign to VM product section

properties.name: power_on
properties.description: (Optional) A boolean value stating if this vApp should be powered on. Default is true

properties.name: org
properties.description: (Optional; v2.0+) The name of organization to use, optional if defined at provider level. Useful when connected as sysadmin working across different organisations

properties.name: vdc
properties.description: (Optional; v2.0+) The name of VDC to use, optional if defined at provider level

properties.name: accept_all_eulas
properties.description: (Optional; v2.0+) Automatically accept EULA if OVA has it. Default is true
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: org
properties.description: (Optional; v2.0+) The name of organization to use, optional if defined at provider level. Useful when connected as sysadmin working across different organisations.

properties.name: vdc
properties.description: (Optional; v2.0+) The name of VDC to use, optional if defined at provider level.

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) A unique name for the network.

properties.name: vapp_name
properties.description: (Required) The vApp this VM should belong to.

properties.name: netmask
properties.description: (Optional) The netmask for the new network. Default is 255.255.255.0.

properties.name: gateway
properties.description: (Optional) The gateway for this network.

properties.name: dns1
properties.description: (Optional) First DNS server to use. Default is 8.8.8.8.

properties.name: dns2
properties.description: (Optional) Second DNS server to use. Default is 8.8.4.4.

properties.name: dns_suffix
properties.description: (Optional) A FQDN for the virtual machines on this network.

properties.name: guest_vlan_allowed
properties.description: (Optional) True if Network allows guest VLAN tagging. This value supported from vCD version 9.0

properties.name: static_ip_pool
properties.description: (Optional) A range of IPs permitted to be used as static IPs for virtual machines; see IP Pools below for details.

properties.name: dhcp_pool
properties.description: (Optional) A range of IPs to issue to virtual machines that don't have a static IP; see IP Pools below for details.

properties.name: ip-pools
properties.description: » IP Pools
Static IP Pools and DHCP Pools support the following attributes:

properties.name: start_address
properties.description: (Required) The first address in the IP Range.

properties.name: end_address
properties.description: (Required) The final address in the IP Range.
DHCP Pools additionally support the following attributes:

properties.name: default_lease_time
properties.description: (Optional) The default DHCP lease time to use. Defaults to 3600.

properties.name: max_lease_time
properties.description: (Optional) The maximum DHCP lease time to use. Defaults to 7200.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: (Optional) Allows to enable or disable service. Default is true.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: org
properties.description: (Optional; v2.0+) The name of organization to use, optional if defined at provider level. Useful when connected as sysadmin working across different organisations

properties.name: vdc
properties.description: (Optional; v2.0+) The name of VDC to use, optional if defined at provider level

properties.name: vapp_name
properties.description: (Required) The vApp this VM should belong to.

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) A unique name for the VM

properties.name: catalog_name
properties.description: (Required) The catalog name in which to find the given vApp Template

properties.name: template_name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the vApp Template to use

properties.name: memory
properties.description: (Optional) The amount of RAM (in MB) to allocate to the VM

properties.name: cpus
properties.description: (Optional) The number of virtual CPUs to allocate to the VM. Socket count is a result of: virtual logical processors/cores per socket

properties.name: cpu_cores
properties.description: (Optional; v2.1+) The number of cores per socket

properties.name: metadata
properties.description: (Optional; v2.2+) Key value map of metadata to assign to this VM

properties.name: initscript
properties.description: (Optional) A script to be run only on initial boot

properties.name: network_name
properties.description: (Optional; Deprecated by network) Name of the network this VM should connect to.

properties.name: vapp_network_name
properties.description: (Optional; v2.1+; Deprecated by network) Name of the vApp network this VM should connect to.

properties.name: ip
properties.description: (Optional; Deprecated by network) The IP to assign to this vApp. Must be an IP address or one of dhcp, allocated, or none. If given the address must be within the static_ip_pool set for the network. If left blank, and the network has dhcp_pool set with at least one available IP then this will be set with DHCP.

properties.name: power_on
properties.description: (Optional) A boolean value stating if this vApp should be powered on. Default is true

properties.name: accept_all_eulas
properties.description: (Optional; v2.0+) Automatically accept EULA if OVA has it. Default is true

properties.name: disk
properties.description: (Optional; v2.1+) Independent disk attachment configuration. See Disk below for details.

properties.name: expose_hardware_virtualization
properties.description: (Optional; v2.2+) Boolean for exposing full CPU virtualization to the guest operating system so that applications that require hardware virtualization can run on virtual machines without binary translation or paravirtualization. Useful for hypervisor nesting provided underlying hardware supports it. Default is false.

properties.name: network
properties.description: (Optional; v2.2+) A block to define network interface. Multiple can be used. See Network and example for usage details. Deprecates: network_name, ip, vapp_network_name. Note: this property and all its parameters do force recreation of VMs!

properties.name: disk-1
properties.description: » Disk

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Independent disk name

properties.name: bus_number
properties.description: (Required) Bus number on which to place the disk controller

properties.name: unit_number
properties.description: (Required) Unit number (slot) on the bus specified by BusNumber.

properties.name: network-1
properties.description: » Network

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Required) Network type, one of: none, vapp or org. none creates a NIC with no network attached, vapp attaches a vApp network, while org attaches organization VDC network.

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Optional) Name of the network this VM should connect to. Always required except for type NONE.

properties.name: is_primary
properties.description: (Optional) Set to true if network interface should be primary. First network card in the list will be primary by default.

properties.name: mac
properties.description: (Computed) Mac address of network interface.

properties.name: list description
properties.description: ip_allocation_mode (Required) IP address allocation mode. One of POOL, DHCP, MANUAL, NONE:

properties.name: POOL
properties.description: Static IP address is allocated automatically from defined static pool in network.

properties.name: DHCP
properties.description: IP address is obtained from a DHCP service. Field ip is not guaranteed to be populated. Because of this it may appear after multiple terraform refresh operations.

properties.name: MANUAL
properties.description: IP address is assigned manually in the ip field. Must be valid IP address from static pool.

properties.name: NONE
properties.description: No IP address will be set because VM will have a NIC without network.

properties.name: list description
properties.description: ip (Optional, Computed) Settings depend on ip_allocation_mode. Field requirements for each ip_allocation_mode are listed below:

properties.name: ip_allocation_mode=POOL
properties.description: ip value must be omitted or empty string "". Empty string may be useful when doing HCL variable interpolation. Field ip will be populated with an assigned IP from static pool after run.

properties.name: ip_allocation_mode=DHCP
properties.description: ip value must be omitted or empty string "". Field ip is not guaranteed to be populated after run due to the VM lacking VMware tools or not working properly with DHCP. Because of this ip may also appear after multiple terraform refresh operations when is reported back to vCD.

properties.name: ip_allocation_mode=MANUAL
properties.description: ip value must be valid IP address from a subnet defined in static pool for network.

properties.name: ip_allocation_mode=NONE
properties.description: ip field can be omitted or set to an empty string "". Empty string may be useful when doing HCL variable interpolation.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: org
properties.description: (Optional) Organization to create the VDC in, optional if defined at provider level

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) VDC name

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) VDC friendly description

properties.name: provider_vdc_name
properties.description: (Required) A name of the Provider VDC from which this organization VDC is provisioned.

properties.name: allocation_model
properties.description: (Required) The allocation model used by this VDC; must be one of {AllocationVApp ("Pay as you go"), AllocationPool ("Allocation pool"), ReservationPool ("Reservation pool")}

properties.name: compute_capacity
properties.description: (Required) The compute capacity allocated to this VDC. See Compute Capacity below for details.

properties.name: nic_quota
properties.description: (Optional) Maximum number of virtual NICs allowed in this VDC. Defaults to 0, which specifies an unlimited number.

properties.name: network_quota
properties.description: (Optional) Maximum number of network objects that can be deployed in this VDC. Defaults to 0, which means no networks can be deployed.

properties.name: vm_quota
properties.description: (Optional) The maximum number of VMs that can be created in this VDC. Includes deployed and undeployed VMs in vApps and vApp templates. Defaults to 0, which specifies an unlimited number.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: (Optional) True if this VDC is enabled for use by the organization VDCs. Default is true.

properties.name: storage_profile
properties.description: (Required) Storage profiles supported by this VDC. See Storage Profile below for details.

properties.name: memory_guaranteed
properties.description: (Optional) Percentage of allocated memory resources guaranteed to vApps deployed in this VDC. For example, if this value is 0.75, then 75% of allocated resources are guaranteed. Required when AllocationModel is AllocationVApp or AllocationPool. When Allocation model is AllocationPool minimum value is 0.2. If left empty, vCD sets a value.

properties.name: cpu_guaranteed
properties.description: (Optional) Percentage of allocated CPU resources guaranteed to vApps deployed in this VDC. For example, if this value is 0.75, then 75% of allocated resources are guaranteed. Required when AllocationModel is AllocationVApp or AllocationPool. If left empty, vCD sets a value.

properties.name: cpu_speed
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the clock frequency, in Megahertz, for any virtual CPU that is allocated to a VM. A VM with 2 vCPUs will consume twice as much of this value. Ignored for ReservationPool. Required when AllocationModel is AllocationVApp or AllocationPool, and may not be less than 256 MHz. Defaults to 1000 MHz if value isn't provided.

properties.name: metadata
properties.description: (Optional; v2.4+) Key value map of metadata to assign to this VDC

properties.name: enable_thin_provisioning
properties.description: (Optional) Boolean to request thin provisioning. Request will be honored only if the underlying data store supports it. Thin provisioning saves storage space by committing it on demand. This allows over-allocation of storage.

properties.name: enable_fast_provisioning
properties.description: (Optional) Request fast provisioning. Request will be honored only if the underlying datastore supports it. Fast provisioning can reduce the time it takes to create virtual machines by using vSphere linked clones. If you disable fast provisioning, all provisioning operations will result in full clones.

properties.name: network_pool_name
properties.description: (Optional) Reference to a network pool in the Provider VDC. Required if this VDC will contain routed or isolated networks.

properties.name: allow_over_commit
properties.description: (Optional) Set to false to disallow creation of the VDC if the AllocationModel is AllocationPool or ReservationPool and the ComputeCapacity you specified is greater than what the backing Provider VDC can supply. Default is true.

properties.name: enable_vm_discovery
properties.description: (Optional) If true, discovery of vCenter VMs is enabled for resource pools backing this VDC. If false, discovery is disabled. If left unspecified, the actual behaviour depends on enablement at the organization level and at the system level.

properties.name: delete_force
properties.description: (Required) When destroying use delete_force=True to remove a VDC and any objects it contains, regardless of their state.

properties.name: delete_recursive
properties.description: (Required) When destroying use delete_recursive=True to remove the VDC and any objects it contains that are in a state that normally allows removal.

properties.name: storage-profile
properties.description: » Storage Profile

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Name of Provider VDC storage profile.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: (Optional) True if this storage profile is enabled for use in the VDC. Default is true.

properties.name: limit
properties.description: (Required) Maximum number of MB allocated for this storage profile. A value of 0 specifies unlimited MB.

properties.name: default
properties.description: (Required) True if this is default storage profile for this VDC. The default storage profile is used when an object that can specify a storage profile is created with no storage profile specified.

properties.name: compute-capacity
properties.description: » Compute Capacity
Capacity must be specified twice, once for memory and another for cpu. Each has the same structure:

properties.name: allocated
properties.description: (Optional) Capacity that is committed to be available. Value in MB or MHz. Used with AllocationPool ("Allocation pool") and ReservationPool ("Reservation pool").

properties.name: limit
properties.description: (Optional) Capacity limit relative to the value specified for Allocation. It must not be less than that value. If it is greater than that value, it implies over provisioning. A value of 0 specifies unlimited units. Value in MB or MHz. Used with AllocationVApp ("Pay as you go").
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: org
properties.description: (Optional) The name of organization to use, optional if defined at provider level. Useful when connected as sysadmin working across different organisations

properties.name: vdc
properties.description: (Optional) The name of VDC to use, optional if defined at provider level

properties.name: edge_gateway
properties.description: (Required) The name of the edge gateway on which the service monitor is to be created

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Service Monitor name

properties.name: interval
properties.description: (Optional) Interval in seconds at which a server is to be monitored using the specified Method. Defaults to 10

properties.name: timeout
properties.description: (Optional) Maximum time in seconds within which a response from the server must be received. Defaults to 15

properties.name: max_retries
properties.description: (Optional) Number of times the specified monitoring Method must fail sequentially before the server is declared down. Defaults to 3

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Required) Select the way in which you want to send the health check request to the server — http, https, tcp, icmp, or udp. Depending on the type selected, the remaining attributes are allowed or not

properties.name: method
properties.description: (Optional) For types http and https. Select http method to be used to detect server status. One of OPTIONS, GET, HEAD, POST, PUT, DELETE, TRACE, or CONNECT

properties.name: url
properties.description: (Optional) For types http and https. URL to be used in the server status request

properties.name: send
properties.description: (Optional) For types http, https, and udp. The data to be sent.

properties.name: expected
properties.description: (Optional) For types http and https. String that the monitor expects to match in the status line of the HTTP or HTTPS response (for example, HTTP/1.1)

properties.name: receive
properties.description: (Optional) For types http, https, and udp. The string to be matched in the response content. Note: When expected is not matched, the monitor does not try to match the Receive content

properties.name: extension
properties.description: (Optional) A map of advanced monitor parameters as key=value pairs (i.e. max-age=SECONDS, invert-regex) Note: When you need a value of key only format just set value to empty string (i.e. linespan = "")
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: org
properties.description: (Optional) The name of organization to use, optional if defined at provider level. Useful when connected as sysadmin working across different organisations

properties.name: vdc
properties.description: (Optional) The name of VDC to use, optional if defined at provider level

properties.name: edge_gateway
properties.description: (Required) The name of the edge gateway on which the server pool is to be created

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Server Pool name

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) Server Pool description

properties.name: algorithm
properties.description: (Required) Server Pool load balancing method. Can be one of ip-hash, round-robin, uri, leastconn, url, or httpheader

properties.name: algorithm_parameters
properties.description: (Optional) Valid only when algorithm is httpheader or url. The httpheader algorithm parameter has one option headerName=<name> while the url algorithm parameter has option urlParam=<url>.

properties.name: enable_transparency
properties.description: (Optional) When transparency is false (default) backend servers see the IP address of the traffic source as the internal IP address of the load balancer. When it is true the source IP address is the actual IP address of the client and the edge gateway must be set as the default gateway to ensure that return packets go through the edge gateway.

properties.name: monitor_id
properties.description: (Optional) vcd_lb_service_monitor resource id to attach to server pool for health check parameters

properties.name: member
properties.description: (Optional) A block to define server pool members. Multiple can be used. See Member and example for usage details.

properties.name: member-1
properties.description: » Member

properties.name: condition
properties.description: (Required) State of member in a pool. One of enabled, disabled, or drain. When member condition is set to drain it stops taking new connections and calls, while it allows its sessions on existing connections to continue until they naturally end. This allows to gracefully remove member node from load balancing rotation.

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Member name

properties.name: ip_address
properties.description: (Required) Member IP address

properties.name: port
properties.description: (Required) The port at which the member is to receive traffic from the load balancer.

properties.name: monitor_port
properties.description: (Required) Monitor Port at which the member is to receive health monitor requests. Note: can be the same as port

properties.name: weight
properties.description: (Required) The proportion of traffic this member is to handle. Must be an integer in the range 1-256.

properties.name: min_connections
properties.description: (Optional) The maximum number of concurrent connections the member can handle. Note: when the number of incoming requests exceeds the maximum, requests are queued and the load balancer waits for a connection to be released.

properties.name: max_connections
properties.description: (Optional) The minimum number of concurrent connections a member must always accept.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: org
properties.description: (Optional) The name of organization to use, optional if defined at provider level. Useful when connected as sysadmin working across different organisations

properties.name: vdc
properties.description: (Optional) The name of VDC to use, optional if defined at provider level

properties.name: edge_gateway
properties.description: (Required) The name of the edge gateway on which the application profile is to be created

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Application profile name

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Required) Protocol type used to send requests to the server. One of tcp, udp, http, or https

properties.name: enable_ssl_passthrough
properties.description: (Optional) Enable SSL authentication to be passed through to the virtual server. Otherwise SSL authentication takes place at the destination address

properties.name: http_redirect_url
properties.description: (Optional) The URL to which traffic that arrives at the destination address should be redirected. Only applies for types http and https

properties.name: persistence_mechanism
properties.description: (Optional) Persistence mechanism for the profile. One of 'cookie', 'ssl-sessionid', 'sourceip'

properties.name: cookie_name
properties.description: (Optional) Used to uniquely identify the session the first time a client accesses the site. The load balancer refers to this cookie when connecting subsequent requests in the session, so that they all go to the same virtual server. Only applies for persistence_mechanism 'cookie'

properties.name: cookie_mode
properties.description: (Optional) The mode by which the cookie should be inserted. One of 'insert', 'prefix', or 'appsession'

properties.name: expiration
properties.description: (Optional) Length of time in seconds that persistence stays in effect

properties.name: insert_x_forwarded_http_header
properties.description: (Optional) Enables 'X-Forwarded-For' header for identifying the originating IP address of a client connecting to a Web server through the load balancer. Only applies for types http and https

properties.name: enable_pool_side_ssl
properties.description: (Optional) Enable to define the certificate, CAs, or CRLs used to authenticate the load balancer from the server side. Note: This resource does not currently support attaching Pool and Virtual Server certificates therefore this toggle only enables it. To make it fully work certificates must be currently attached manually.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: org
properties.description: (Optional) The name of organization to use, optional if defined at provider level. Useful when connected as sysadmin working across different organisations

properties.name: vdc
properties.description: (Optional) The name of VDC to use, optional if defined at provider level

properties.name: edge_gateway
properties.description: (Required) The name of the edge gateway on which the application rule is to be created

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Application rule name

properties.name: script
properties.description: (Required) A multiline application rule script. Terraform's HEREDOC syntax may be useful for multiline scripts. Note: For information on the application rule syntax, see more in vCloud Director documentation
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: org
properties.description: (Optional) The name of organization to use, optional if defined at provider level. Useful when connected as sysadmin working across different organisations

properties.name: vdc
properties.description: (Optional) The name of VDC to use, optional if defined at provider level

properties.name: edge_gateway
properties.description: (Required) The name of the edge gateway on which the virtual server is to be created

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Virtual server name

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) Virtual server description

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: (Optional) Defines if the virtual server is enabled. Default true

properties.name: enable_acceleration
properties.description: (Optional) Defines if the virtual server uses acceleration. Default false

properties.name: ip_address
properties.description: (Required) Set the IP address that the load balancer listens on

properties.name: protocol
properties.description: (Required) Select the protocol that the virtual server accepts. One of tcp, udp, http, or https Note: You must select the same protocol used by the selected Application Profile

properties.name: port
properties.description: (Required) The port number that the load balancer listens on

properties.name: connection_limit
properties.description: (Optional) Maximum concurrent connections that the virtual server can process

properties.name: connection_rate_limit
properties.description: (Optional) Maximum incoming new connection requests per second

properties.name: server_pool_id
properties.description: (Optional) The server pool that the load balancer will use

properties.name: app_profile_id
properties.description: (Optional) Application profile ID to be associated with the virtual server

properties.name: app_rule_ids
properties.description: (Optional) List of attached application rule IDs
